senses.sense_definition: The brightest star in the constellation Lyra, forming one corner of the Summer Triangle.

examples.text: Astronomers use the star <w>Vega</w> as a reference point for measuring brightness.
On a clear summer night, you can easily spot <w>Vega</w> directly overhead.
We invited Mr. <w>Vega</w> to speak at the conference about his research.
The <w>Vega</w> family has lived in this neighborhood for over fifty years.

senses.sense_definition: A small city in Texas, United States.

examples.text: They stopped in <w>Vega</w> to refuel during their road trip across Texas.
The town of <w>Vega</w> is located on the famous Route 66.

senses.sense_definition: A measurement of an option's price sensitivity to changes in the volatility of the underlying asset.

examples.text: Traders monitor <w>vega</w> to understand how market volatility will affect their portfolio.
An option with high <w>vega</w> will increase in value significantly if volatility rises.

senses.sense_definition: An open tract of ground or a plain, especially one that is moist and fertile.

examples.text: The farmers planted their crops in the rich soil of the <w>vega</w>.
Heavy rains often flood the <w>vega</w>, making it difficult to traverse.

traits.comment: often used in contexts involving Spanish geography or loanwords

senses.sense_definition: A model of automobile manufactured by Chevrolet in the 1970s.

examples.text: My grandfather used to drive a blue <w>Vega</w> to work every day.
The Chevrolet <w>Vega</w> is now considered a classic car by some collectors.
